author: Brent Williams
comment: For the most part this app is very useful, but the widget is what I use most and it has a few issues. For starts it always crashes if I restart my phone, another thing is the initial height of the widget is too tall it ends up taking up more space than any other widget.

author: Mario Sandulescu
comment: Such a cool app loved it for a long time. .. now it has this annoying glitch: when I try to add another location/city for concerts it cannot find it .. hope it's fixed in time

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello Mario, thanks for reaching out and sorry for the trouble. Can you please email support@bandsintown.com and we can look into this? Thanks.

comment: GF missed a concert here, I pulled up the next closest show and bought tix for her bday. Yep. She's gonna marry me someday.

author: Jesse Thomas
comment: Painful and not intuitive to navigate.

author: Em Kelman
comment: Shows are my vice. This is my tool. Love it, I can keep track of every artist I listen too. Efficient FB sharing to invite/inform.

author: Ron Garcia
comment: Downloaded twice...past 20min can't search any artist

author: M Nelson
comment: Iove the suggested bands

author: Andrew Woods
comment: Good Concert app. Very.
I've always loved YouTube.
Awesome

Installed, and uninstalled almost right away. Looked promising, but I'm unable to change my location. For some reason it put me in a place far away (weird since I'm on wifi...), and I can't set it back correctly.  This kind of apppications shouldn't have such a complicated way to check other locations anyway - people move for concerts.

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello, thanks for reaching out and apologies for the trouble. Can you please email support@bandsintown.com and we can look into it? Thanks.

author: David Thompson
comment: App was good until this messaging bs got added. I and everyone else have facebook, so it just seems redundant to add a messaging feature to the app. Tried to disable this feature, but the only way to do so is to stop tracking the artists. Fix this problem and the app will be good again 😐

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello David, thanks for reaching out and sorry for the trouble. You should be able to disable any notifications. Please email support@bandsintown.com if you are having any trouble with this, thanks.

author: Scott Wannell
comment: Unable to change location.  Used correct format as detailed in documentation (City, ST), but always get “location entered was not found”, even when I enter the currently set location.  Cleared data, reinstalled app, nothing.  Emailed support four days ago.  Have heard nothing.

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello Scott, thanks for reaching out. If you are still having trouble can you please email ajenkins@bandsintown.com and we can help you there? Thanks.

author: Lauren Merkle
comment: loved the app but apparently not all show times are correct. saw another time posted somewhere else day of so I ended up being late and missed the first half of my show ! not happy. 😤

author: Tankiso Skosana
comment: Is there a way of just viewing event details on this app? Can I please just view an event without it being added to my calendar? And once I rsvp, just because I wanted to see ticket prices which I still haven't seen btw, is there a way of just removing the event from my list?  And why am I forced to use the app anyway? Why am I not afforded an option to do all this stuff on the website?

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello Tankiso, thanks for reaching out. You can view an event without adding it to your calendar, the event only gets added to your calendar once your RSVP. You can also always remove the app from your RSVPs if you do not want it there. If you are having trouble please email support@bandsintown.com. Thanks.

author: Wil Hedrick
comment: Too difficult to navigate. Nearly impossible to browse through all upcoming events, even in a given date range, because so many events are duplicated. And if you select something for more info, then go back to the search list, it kicks you back to the top. The most effective way to use the app is to already know what you're looking for going in.

author: Ivana R
comment: Good app & found a lot of concerts through the app, but i cannot save the changes i made to the notifications. Even when i silenced the notifications, it still made a sound. It gets annoying.  Edit: Updated the app and my notification settings were saved.

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hi Ivana, please make sure you're on the latest version of the app. It looks like you're running an older version, we've fixed it since then. Thanks for reporting the issue!

author: Mister Dupeep
comment: Bandsintown doesn't sell tickets to canceled or non existent shows like songkick. A regularly updated and in the know source that is reliable and easy to contact. Couldn't be happier with the service

author: Michael Moses
comment: Ever since Feb 2018, the app sends 3 to 6 notifications each day, despite all settings saying all notifications are turned off. Only way to stop them, it appears, is to delete the app.

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello Michael, thanks for reaching out and apologies for the delay. Can you please email support@bandsintown.com and we can look into this? Thanks.

comment: The only problem is that it limits notifications to 150 miles, so if your favorite artists don't come very close to you, you'll never know.

author: keith Nebor
comment: STILL NOT RECEIVING ANY NOTIFICATIONS !!!  You guys seem to only notify me that tickets are going on sale the day of the show, how the hell am I supposed to go to the show when you're telling me tickets are on sale & the show is that night. Doesn't make any sense, you're not giving me any time to buy tickets.          PLEASE FIX ,this has been going on for over 6 months now. So I'm actually missing shows because of your app. Going to have to start looking somewhere else tthat has the right information i need !!!

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello, thanks for letting us know. We would like to troubleshoot this problem for you, please email support@bandsintown.com and we will do our best to help you.

author: erin franklin
comment: it's great having all concert listings in one place, especially since ticketmaster doesn't sell the tickets for every concert. it's much easier than going to each venue's site calender. love this app.

author: gary kiger
comment: For some reason app won't let me update or change my location.  Makes it basically worthless.

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello Gary, thanks for reaching out. Can you please email support@bandsintown.com and we can look into it? Thanks.

author: Jessica Romero
comment: Definite major improvement. Haven't had a chance to explore all the new stuff yet but loving what I see so far

author: Ashley Taylor
comment: This app gives wrong tour dates information 👎

reply.author: Bandsintown
reply.content: Hello Ashley, thanks for reaching out. Can you please email support@bandsintown.com? Thanks.

author: Victoria Tortorelli
comment: I feel like it knows me, bad or good, it told me about a great local show I would have otherwise missed

author: Vivian Li
comment: I will travel for concerts, so I wish there wasn't a radius limit on the search

author: William Krett
comment: Effectively informative. The recommendation feature is nice. Reminders are alright too.

author: Audio Bear
comment: Perfect way to know when your favorite bands come near you!

author: Eduardo Estrada
comment: Great app. I always find the cheapest tickets available.

author: Taylor Imes
comment: I find out about concerts on Facebook before this app notifies me.

author: Mohit Agrawal
comment: UI and band recommendation algorithm can be improved

author: Amy Smith
comment: Love the notifications. It has helped me find some great local shows.

author: Mooffaloo
comment: Fantastic app. I love everything about it. I've recommended it to many friends already.

author: Emm Caisse
comment: Keeps getting better & better!

author: Dierre Donnie
comment: Great app got the alert and watched QOTSA

author: James Adado
comment: Useful app to find who is coming to town.

author: John Kirkland
comment: Nice integration with calendar.  Good app
its good

author: Xavier Kayser
comment: Niceee
